DOC.brief_summary: This prospective , randomize , control trial compare incidence nosocomial infection ( composite primary bloodstream infection , catheter-associated urinary tract infection , ventilator-associated pneumonia , surgical site infection ) occur intensive care unit ( ICU ) patient bath 2 % chlorhexidine solution versus patient receive standard bathing ( soap water non-medicated cloth ) .
DOC.brief_title: Trial 2 % Chlorhexidine Bathing Nosocomial Infections Surgical Intensive Care Unit
DOC.detailed_description: Upon study enrollment , patient randomize one two study arm . Patients study arm one receive standard bathing ( soap water non-medicated cloth ) daily . Patients study arm two receive 2 % chlorhexidine bath study day 1 every 48 hour standard bath ( soap water non-medicated cloth ) study day 2 every 48 hour . Patients follow ICU day 28 discharge surgical ICU . Hypothesis : Compared standard daily bathing , chlorhexidine-based bathing ICU admission every 48 hour decrease incidence nosocomial infection .
